issue.title: test: rpc_bind.py --ipv4 fails when run on s390x or arm in debian
issue.body:
Commit fa52a2c7b81817694c3aeddb7f6909334b8c9132

Steps to reproduce:

```
FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_arm.sh" MAKEJOBS="-j9" ./ci/test_run_all.sh
```


```
 node0 2019-12-17T20:54:35.953253Z [] ThreadRPCServer method=getblockcount user=__cookie__ 
 test  2019-12-17T20:54:35.959000Z TestFramework.node0 (DEBUG): RPC successfully started 
 test  2019-12-17T20:54:35.966000Z TestFramework (ERROR): Assertion failed 
                                   Traceback (most recent call last):
                                     File "/home/marco/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-arm-linux-gnueabihf/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 112, in main
                                       self.run_test()
                                     File "/home/marco/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-arm-linux-gnueabihf/test/functional/rpc_bind.py", line 89, in run_test
                                       self._run_loopback_tests()
                                     File "/home/marco/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-arm-linux-gnueabihf/test/functional/rpc_bind.py", line 97, in _run_loopback_tests
                                       [('127.0.0.1', self.defaultport)])
                                     File "/home/marco/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-arm-linux-gnueabihf/test/functional/rpc_bind.py", line 43, in run_bind_test
                                       assert_equal(set(get_bind_addrs(pid)), set(expected))
                                     File "/home/marco/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-arm-linux-gnueabihf/test/functional/test_framework/util.py", line 46, in assert_equal
                                       raise AssertionError("not(%s)" % " == ".join(str(arg) for arg in (thing1, thing2) + args))
                                   AssertionError: not(set() == {('7f000001', 16456)})

rename.from: test: rpc_bind.py --ipv4 fails when run in qemu-arm
rename.to: test: rpc_bind.py --ipv4 fails when run on s390x in debian

rename.from: test: rpc_bind.py --ipv4 fails when run on s390x in debian
rename.to: test: rpc_bind.py --ipv4 fails when run on s390x or arm in debian

events.body: This gives me the suspicion that some container-ism prevents `get_bind_addrs` from working (which relies on `/proc` being accessible, for one)

Jup, I think docker is to blame. However, I can't reproduce locally:

```
# ls /.dockerenv && uname -a && cat /etc/debian_version && ./test/functional/rpc_bind.py --ipv4
/.dockerenv
Linux e5c4bf14a0c2 4.15.0-1049-raspi2 #53-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT Wed Oct 2 01:04:00 UTC 2019 aarch64 GNU/Linux
bullseye/sid
2019-12-18T18:20:14.319000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_7xx50ox6
2019-12-18T18:20:14.323000Z TestFramework (INFO): Check for linux
2019-12-18T18:20:14.323000Z TestFramework (INFO): Check for ipv6
2019-12-18T18:20:14.325000Z TestFramework (INFO): Check for non-loopback interface
2019-12-18T18:20:14.327000Z TestFramework (INFO): Bind test for ['127.0.0.1']
2019-12-18T18:20:15.587000Z TestFramework (INFO): Bind test for ['127.0.0.1:32171']
2019-12-18T18:20:16.482000Z TestFramework (INFO): Bind test for ['127.0.0.1:32171', '127.0.0.1:32172']
2019-12-18T18:20:17.332000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
2019-12-18T18:20:17.333000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_7xx50ox6 on exit
2019-12-18T18:20:17.335000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
This was caused by running qemu in docker in lxd for the native platform. Fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17767/commits/fa762775db8c26df0106f5b1fa79862fbb41c6c2

issue.title: ci: Run feature_block in valgrind
issue.body: Also revert commit 0a4912e46aecef6f04c6287508020ec60424ed24, because some tests take too long for this to be useful anymore.

issue.title: ci: Disable rpcbind_test in gitlab-ci
issue.body:
Its not possible to setup default gitlab-ci integration since rpcbind_test.py fails for shared runners in gitlab ci. As this test is also always skipped by our gitlab ci (`TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: This test requires IPv6 support.`) i guess its ok to disable it in the gitlab ci for now?

Might to be related to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17765

events.body:
Possibly unrelated, but `rpc_bind.py --ipv6                                       | âœ– Failed  | 2 s`

With ASan, on GHA: https://github.com/m3dwards/bitcoin/actions/runs/9178831587/job/25239590853#step:5:5070

                                     File "/home/runner/work/bitcoin/bitcoin/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/rpc_bind.py", line 103, in _run_loopback_tests

                                       assert_equal(set(get_bind_addrs(pid)), set(expected))
                                     File "/home/runner/work/bitcoin/bitcoin/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/test_framework/util.py", line 74, in assert_equal

                                   AssertionError: not({('7f000001', 19168)} == {('00000000000000000000000000000001', 19168), ('7f000001', 19168)})
